<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
Code for handling annotations for load balancer is executed only upon load balancer modification, not creation in all versions including master branch.

So, for example, it's not possible to enable cross-zone load balancing upon creation. Only create-then-update process works.
- [1.14.6](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/v1.14.6/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L344)
- [1.15.3](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/v1.15.3/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L326)
- [master](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L336)


**What you expected to happen**:
Annotations  should be parsed both upon creation and update of load balancer

Code, that parses annotations should be moved outside `else` block
- [1.14.6](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/v1.14.6/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L179)
- [1.15.3](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/v1.15.3/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L164)
- [master](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/staging/src/k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L174)

or duplicated in `if` block

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. create `Service.spec.type.LoadBalancer` with:
```yaml
annotations:
  service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type: "nlb"
  service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-cross-zone-load-balancing-enabled: "true"
```
 cross-zone load balancing will be off

2. modify something in `Service` definition — CZLB will be on


**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.14.0—1.14.6, 1.15.0—1.15.3, master
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: AWS
